Question Text: Which way is India headed towards? The capitalists or the Communists?

They distribute the land on nominal taxation, and the vaiśyas utilize the land for cultivation and cow-keeping, and the śūdras, they are engaged as weaver, blacksmith, goldsmith, mean other necessities of life. In this way the whole society is simplified, and the central point is how to become advanced in Kṛṣṇa consciousness by cooperation. This is India's civilization. There is no question of industry. Ugra - karma . It has been condemned in the Bhagavad- gītā as ugra - karma , laboring very hard for livelihood. This industry means engage the poor worker class to work very hard, and there is huge profit, and some directors of the capitalists, they take it. So according to quality, guṇa - karma - vibhāgaśaḥ [Bg. 4.13 ] , there must be division and then simple life. The real aim is tam abhyarcya , how to become Kṛṣṇa conscious. Everyone is.... Brāhmaṇa is guiding, kṣatriya is ruling, and vaiśya is producing food, and śūdra , they have no brain; they are helping. In this way the society is very peaceful, and everyone is advanced in Kṛṣṇa consciousness. This is India's civilization. Now, due to this association of the rākṣasas... Even up to Mohammedan time this civilization was being continued. Mohammedan did not touch the Indian culture. Sometimes by, what is called, fanaticism, there was fight. Not like this. Answer Text: Government (Hindi) They have admitted in the Parliament.

Question Text: They are frightened in the beginning.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: I think they are very slow to act.
Answer Text: No, the real is that all rogues are in the government.

Question Text: Yes, that is the right thing. Not only rogues...
Answer Text: So why don't you, if you are actually serious, why don't you make propaganda in the country that "Please do not give vote to the rogues." Don't mention any party. "If you want to be happy, then don't give vote to the rogues." And who is a rogue? The illicit sex hunters, the intoxicants, and the meat-eaters, and the gamblers. These are rogues.

Question Text: They are all there in Delhi.
Answer Text: No, no, you don't mention any. (aside:) Hare Kṛṣṇa . Jaya . Thank you very much. Hare Kṛṣṇa . Hare Kṛṣṇa . So it is impartial. And actually, if they test that "Whether this man I am voting, he is free from all these sinful activities?" Then, you see, the whole face of the Indian government will change.

Question Text: Sir, I may tell you, the adults.... That change is meant for the educated, cultured, and...
Answer Text: No, no, you don't name that educated, cultured. You simply say that "You vote for this person."

Question Text: People vote for five-rupee notes. They don't vote anything else.
Answer Text: Then they will suffer. Then don't, don't complain. Don't complain.

Question Text: I was a political worker myself and a member of the ruling party and a member of the assembly. I know how they collect votes.
Answer Text: If you.... For five rupees if you sacrifice your sacred right, then how can you expect good government?

Question Text: But they never desired to have these rights. They should be disenfranchised, those who will not understand their responsibility towards their country.
Answer Text: So at least you can make some propaganda that "Don't give votes to these persons." Don't name any. Then he will be envious. No.

Question Text: You will be in the jail.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: I don't mind going to the...
Answer Text: No, if you preach these moral principles, nobody will object. Nobody will object.

Question Text: They are shamming themselves as big moralist. They go to temples and what not and what not and what not. And then they...
Answer Text: But still in India they will never accept a drunkard as moralist. Still.

Question Text: Sir, all of them are drunkards, who are there.
Answer Text: You cannot say.

Question Text: Majority, sir.
Answer Text: Mass of people, they are not drunkard.

Question Text: Not mass, I mean those people who are in Delhi.
Answer Text: They? They are not majority. Therefore we have to reform.

Question Text: Only God will reform them by giving them.... They should be chastised.
Answer Text: They are being chastised, but they are so fool, they cannot understand they are being chastised. Just like a dog is being chastised. He cannot have eating, eatables, whole day and night, eating stool. Somebody's stoning, somebody's sticking, and still, he is very jubilant: " Gow, gow, gow, gow, I am very happy." (laughter) This is going on. So this dog's association, dog society, they are suffering in every step; still, they are thinking, "We are making progress." That's all. Dog civilization. Hog civilization. Dog civilization. This is not civilization. Nāyaṁ deho deha - bhājāṁ nṛloke kaṣṭān kāmān arhate viḍ- bhujāṁ ye [SB 5.5.1 ] . Dog civilization.

Question Text: Sir, this civilization is degrading because of the cinemas and things. The mothers are the really...
Answer Text: And you do not know. Cinema is not cause. Cause is godlessness.

Question Text: But because the godlessness starts from there.
Answer Text: No, no, no.

Question Text: Who are the ideals of these women? The cinema actresses. Who were the ideals of our mothers? Sāvitrī and Sītā .
Answer Text: There are so many, so many.

Question Text: That is very important. This is very important, sir.; Puṣṭa Kṛṣṇa : There are many cinemas in America...; (Hindi); I mean, one percent. But many cinemas are there. I have not seen. The people say so.
Answer Text: You see, when a man is diseased there are many symptoms of ailments. You cannot say.... You are a physician. You know. You cannot say, "This is the cause of the disease." It is.... Real, one disease is there, and there are so many ailments. So you cannot say...

Question Text: You mean the cause of the cause of the cause is godlessness.
Answer Text: Yes.

Question Text: Puṣṭa Kṛṣṇa : Symptoms are there.; Cause of the cause of the cause.
Answer Text: Yes. These are only outward...

Question Text: (Hindi)
Answer Text: Yes. There are.... In logic there are two causes: immediate cause and remote cause. So remote cause is taken into consideration.

Question Text: The important cause is the Kali - yuga .
Answer Text: That Vijaya Datta (?) is interested for gurukula.

Question Text: Yes.
Answer Text: Why not construct a big building for gurukula here? The students will be trained up to come here and sporting, having nice bath and chant Hare Kṛṣṇa and build up their character. And in Bombay you will get many children, because there are so many rich men. They are not so much concerned to make their children technologist. If they get good education and character, they will give. Technologists they can purchase. Birla, they are not going to be technologist. They purchase technologist. I have seen in many respectable Marwari house. They don't send their children to school. They don't send.

Question Text: After matriculation they go to the office.
Answer Text: No matriculation. They engage good paṇḍitas, good teachers, and teach them at home, and, as soon as they are able to read and write and see accounts, immediately engage in the business. They know that "We can purchase technologist. Why shall I waste time for so-called education, Ph.D., D.A.C.?" You have seen that Ph.D. in our Vṛndāvana ? Useless. So many Ph.D.'s are useless. Cannot earn their livelihood. I have seen. So what is the use? Tasyaiva hetoḥ prayateta . Because one has become.... I have seen one Ph.D. chemist in Allahabad. He could not get any job. Then he was manufacturing soap at home and taking it in cycle and going to the market just like ordinary coolie. These so-called educationists, unless they get a good job, they are useless street dog. Useless. They cannot earn even livelihood. Therefore śāstra says, "Don't try for these things, to increase your economic position. This is already destined. You cannot increase or decrease. Whatever you are destined, you must get it. Try to get Kṛṣṇa consciousness."
